title: 149.0b1 - userChrome.css settings for message-list colors stopped working
creator: dan7miller
content:
I've been using color settings in userChrome.css to set the colors for the threads and folder panes... I obtained these settings from a discussion in the Thunderbird Beta mailing list, back in 2023. Here are my current settings:

root { 
 /* Force BG in unthemed folder */  --foldertree-background: #A99B92 !important;  /* Force BG in threads */  --tree-view-bg: #A99B92 !important;  /* Force black text in threads */  --tree-view-color: #000 !important;

} /* Position Menu Bar above Unified Toolbar */

  1. toolbar-menubar { order: -1 !important;}

However, after the most recent beta update, the tree-view settings are no longer working, and I'm stuck once again with the ghastly Bright White background... see the attached image; note that the foldertree setting is still working though...

What do I need to do, to get this code working again? or is this a bug in the current beta?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0;tb_version:149.0b1;os:Windows 10;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/thunderbird-add-ons-frequently-asked-questions"];solver_id:5278459

title: Why does T'bird not show ALL the messages in my inbox on Zoho mail?
creator: neil91
content:
I have just moved all my email accounts to Zoho mail, under my private domain.

My Neil@ box delivers mail to Thunderbird on Windows 11 and to the Zoho app on Android. All seems well there so far as I've seen so far.

BUT my Jim@ account delivers to the Zoho app on Android and to Thunderbird on Ubuntu 18.4. A significant number of messages show up on Android but NOT on Thunderbird. T'bird doesn't have them in spam or trash or any other possible place, and our filters haven't changed since we used a non-Zoho mail server. Besides, if T'bird marks a message as spam, wouldn't the mail server do the same? It doesn't.

This is a pretty serious problem for us, as we do all our work on desktops, not cellphones.

What can I do to find the problem and fix it?

Thank you!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/145.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/145.0.0.0;tb_version:102.11.0 (64-bit);os:Ubuntu 18.04.6TS

title: Problems setting up Thunderbird on a new PC
creator: kenbailey143
content: I am trying to set up Thunderbird on a new PC (my old PC died following a power outage). Trying to set up a New Account, I enter the email address I normally use. It asks me for a password. I have tried passwords I have just set up for Mozilla, Thunderbird, Virgin (three of them) and even Google. I am sick of seeing ‘Authentication error’ with not help offered. I never set up a password when I started using Thunderbird many years ago. I keep all my password. There is no option when a password is forgotten or for a new one to be set up. If you can’t or won’t assist, can you recommend a different email app. I have spend so long on this! Cheers, Ken Bailey

title: can't send mail on  new personal Outlook.com account
creator: tbirdUser_t3
content:
Can get(POP3), but can not send emails to a newly created personal outlook.com account.

the following error occurs when trying to send mail: Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) . Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)

all my setting are correct per thunderbird and microsoft: 

  (smtp-mail.outlook.com, port 587,  STARTTLS, OAUTH2, xxxxx@outlook.com)

thunderbird error log file contains the following: . . . mailnews.smtp: S: 535 5.7.139 Authentication unsuccessful, SmtpClientAuthentication is disabled for the Mailbox. Visit https://aka.ms/smtp_auth_disabled for more information. [CH5P220CA0005.NAMP220.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM 2026-02-28T23:29:21.878Z 08DE7703D4D1982A]

SmtpClient.sys.mjs:452:17 mailnews.smtp: Command failed: 535 Authentication unsuccessful, SmtpClientAuthentication is disabled for the Mailbox. Visit https://aka.ms/smtp_auth_disabled for more information. [CH5P220CA0005.NAMP220.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM 2026-02-28T23:29:21.878Z 08DE7703D4D1982A]; currentAction=_actionAUTH_XOAUTH2 SmtpClient.sys.mjs:578:19 mailnews.smtp: Error during AUTH XOAUTH2, sending empty response . . .


Based on my understanding its seems thunderbird is using SMTP AUTH instead of OAUTH2 as required for newer personal outlook.com accounts. Is my assessment correct? If so, is there a fix?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:140.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/140.0;tb_version:140.8.0esr;os:Windows 10

title: OAUTH to Yahoo fails after TB v148 upgrade
creator: winthrop.yu+Moz
content:
TB on Windows

Prior to TB 148, OAUTH worked for POP3 access to: Gmail, MS Outlook, and Yahoo.

After TB 148 upgrade: OAUTH to Yahoo fails, subsequent log-in page also fails. Both OAUTH to Gmail and OAUTH to MS Outlook still work fine.

Rolled-back/Reverted to TB 147.0.2 -- OAUTH to all works fine, as it did previously.

Note: YahooMail seems to have other problems. But I was able to confirm successful OAUTH and POP3 to YahooMail after reversion to 147.0.2.

title: Thunderbird v14.0.2 (64bit) Unified Inbox not displaying
creator: davidrmilnes
content:
Since updating Thunderbird 64 bit to v147.0.2, then to v148.0 (1st March 2026, just now), requesting the display of 'Unified Folders' (in Folder Modes) does not populate the unified Inbox with messages from any of my eight registered email inbox sources. The individual inboxes with their contents can be displayed below, but not in the unified Inbox.

Since being introduced several versions ago, I have found this feature very useful when checking my various received emails, and it is frustrating to be without it.

Can anyone suggest what I may or may not be doing to get this feature to work any more? I have been all through Settings, but cannot find anything relevant to this problem.

Cheers, Sam
